summary.title: Generic Development Pipeline Threat Model
summary.description: A generic threat model for a CI/CD pipeline

diagrams.title: Automated Pipeline Threat Model- Threats to Code, Containers & CI Tooling Only

threats.title: Github endpoints are spoofed
threats.description: GIthub endpoints are spoofed and used to serve malicious code to a recepient, or used to compromise a users submitted credentials, or confidentiality of submitted code.
threats.mitigation:
Use of HTTPS validates the Github server by default.
Ensure Developers validate server key fingerprint on first connection.

threats.title: Project Code stored in Github is tampered  with by Github employee
threats.description: Github consumed as a SaaS, with GIthub employees having access to customer data. A rogue employee could tamper with a project's code.
threats.mitigation:
Github internal processes (out of scope)
Code Signing
Acceptance as a residual risk by the project.

threats.title: Project Code/User Credentials are accessed by a Github employee
threats.description: Github consumed as a SaaS, with GIthub employees having access to customer data. A rogue employee could view a project's code and embedded credentials or user credentials.
threats.mitigation:
Don't hardcode credentials within code. Store them in github encrypted.
User Credential policy.
Residual risk that needs accepting by the business.

threats.title: GIthub is subject to DoS attack
threats.description: Github is subject to a DoS attack, making a projects code inaccessible, or Github unable to act as a federated identity provider to jenkins
threats.mitigation:
Mitigations against DoS/DDoS attacks are managed by github
Temporary loss of service is a residual risk that needs to be accepted by the business.

threats.title: Github co-tenant bypasses RBAC controls to access a projects private repo
threats.description:
Github co-tenant bypasses RBAC controls to access a projects private repo.

Confidentiality of code and embedded plaintext credentials compromised
threats.mitigation:
GIthub manage and develop the RBAC controls for the service.
Residual risk that requires sign off by the business.
Encrypt credentials

threats.title: Developer accidentally/deliberately commits a malicious/vulnerable piece of code.
threats.description: Developer accidentally/deliberately commits a malicious/vulnerable piece of code.
threats.mitigation:
Coding Standards
Peer Review
Static Code Analysis
Dynamic Security Testing tools...
GPG signing for non-repudiation

threats.title: Plaintext Credentials embedded within code
threats.description: Plaintext credentials are embedded within  code, and can be observed and used for malicious purposes by those with access to the repo.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt credentials when storing within Git using a project such as Gitcrypt.

threats.title: Github permanent loss of data
threats.description: A major Github outage results in the loss of customer data, such as projects stored by the project.
threats.mitigation:
Offline Backup
Backup with another supplier
Informally code can be retrieved from developer EUDs
Business to accept residual risk

threats.title: User RBAC misconfiguration/privilige creep
threats.description: A user is either assigned into the wrong role, or obtains greater permissions than required owing to privilige creep.
threats.mitigation: User Audit

threats.title: Standard GIthub user is able to view a Projects code
threats.description:
A Github user that is not a member of the project or organisation is able to view a projects code.

Impacts of this include: loss of IP, exposure and malicious usage of embedded plaintext credentials.
threats.mitigation:
Use of private repositories.
RBAC and least privilege enforcement within an organisation.

threats.title: Former Employee is able to tamper with a projects code
threats.description: Due to a lack of offboarding, a former employee uses access to tamper with a projects code
threats.mitigation:
Offboarding Policy/Procedure
User Audit
Peer review
GPG signing for non-repudiation

threats.title: Former Employee is able to view a projects code
threats.description:
Due to a lack of offboarding, a former employee is able to view a projects code.

Potential impacts include: loss of IP, malicious use of plaintext credentials.
threats.mitigation:
User Audit
Offboarding policy/procedures
Encrypt stored credentials

threats.title: Misconfigured Bot account
threats.mitigation:
RBAC Least privilege 
User Audit
threats.description: Bot credentials for use by CI servers etc do not enforce least privilege. A threat actor or impatient insider will inherit these privileges and can abuse them.

threats.title: Open source code element compromised at source (TBC)
threats.description:
An open source code element referenced within the code is compromised.
Requires further investigation.

threats.title: Users Credentials are compromised and a threat actor impersonates the user.
threats.description: User Credentials - Passwords, SSH keys, access tokens are stored in plain text on a users device. If these are compromised, a threat actor could assume the identity of the user to compromise integrity, availability or confidentiality of code in GIthub
threats.mitigation:
EUD hardening 
Password policy
For HTTPS GUI access - enforce 2FA
For SSH CLI access - add a password to be used on key usage
Store SSH keys on a seperate hardware token. 
Daily expiry of Access tokens and reissuing via GUI with 2FA enforced (?)

threats.title: Developer performs malicious action and denies it, blaming credential compromise
threats.description: A developer performs a malicious action (e.g. a commit consisting of malicious code) and denies undertaking it, blaming a compromise of credentials.
threats.mitigation:
Signing of commits/merges using gpg key on hardware token.
Strong authentication consisting of 2 factors.

cells.reasonOutOfScope: Provided as part of a SAAS, transparent to the customer.
Provided as part of a SAAS, transparent to the customer.
Provided as part of a SAAS, transparent to the customer.
Provided as part of a SAAS, transparent to the customer.
Provided as part of a SAAS, transparent to the customer.
Provided as part of a SAAS, transparent to the customer.

threats.title: Jenkins server spoofed
threats.description: Motivation?
threats.mitigation: HTTPS by default validates server identity

threats.title: Jenkins Build Jobs modified at run time
threats.description: Jenkins build jobs are defined in code, however they can be manually modified at run time by those with the right permissions, affecting the integrity of the build.
threats.mitigation:
Jenkins RBAC
Logging & PM

threats.title: Jenkins stores credentials in plain text
threats.description:
In order for Jenkins to pull code from Github (SSH), to deploy to Kubernetes or to push an image to artifactory it will need to use credentials

For integration tests etc. Jenkins could also store AWS keys that have the ability to provision temporary instances of RDS/S3 etc 

These are stored in a form that's accessible in plain text to a user with sufficient permissions. These could be abused.
threats.mitigation:
RBAC on Jenkins and least privilege to reduce exposure of keys.
RBAC and least privilege enforced on the secrets themselves 
Strong Authentication to Jenkins

threats.title: Jenkins is subject to a DDoS attack by an internet based actor
threats.description: Jenkins is internet facing and is subject to a DDoS attack
threats.mitigation:
Restrict access to those with a VPN.
IP whitelist to approved managemet/support locations

threats.title: Unauthenticated User gains access to Jenkins
threats.description: An unauthenticated user on the internet gains access to Jenkins through exploiting a vulnerability.
threats.mitigation:
Place Jenkins behind a VPN
IP whitelist to approved management/support locations
Keep Jenkins Patched and up to date
Port and Service Hardening

threats.title: User with Admin Permissions alters configuration (TBC)
threats.description:
A user with admin permissions maliciously tampers with the Jenkins configuration.

Motive unclear...
threats.mitigation: Logging and Protective monitoring.

threats.title: Former employee gains Jenkins access due to lack of offboarding.
threats.description: Due to a lack of offboarding, a former employee uses access to extract credentials from Jenkins to be used maliciously.
threats.mitigation: Offboarding policy.

threats.title: Authenticed user uses Jenkins Script Console used for malicious purposes
threats.description:
The Jenkins script console allows a user to execute arbitrary groovy scripts within the Jenkins runtime. 
The Jenkins container currently has root permissions on the host.
threats.mitigation:
Disable Jenkins Script Console 
or use RBAC to limit access to Jenkins Script Console to Admins.
Logging and Protective Monitoring.

threats.title: Jenkins User auth credentials compromised
threats.description: A threat actor obtains Jenkins User credentials, and attempts to use these to access Jenkins/inherit a users permission set.
threats.mitigation:
EUDs appropriately hardened
2FA using a Time Based One Time Password
2FA back up code management
Logging/Monitoring
Jenkins behind VPN or access limited using IP whitelisting.

threats.title: Bruteforce attack on Jenkins
threats.description: An internet based threat actor attempts to bruteforce Jenkins username/password login.
threats.mitigation:
Logging/Monitoring
Automated account locking.
2FA using TOTP

threats.title: Artifactory is spoofed to obtain passwords/API keys or uploaded images
threats.description: Spoofing with the motivation of obtaining passwords/api keys for use against the real instance, or for uploaded artifacts to compromise their confidentiality.
threats.mitigation:
HTTPS handles server identity verification by default
SSH access requires validation of the servers fingerprint

threats.title: Developer uploads malicious image directly into artifactory.
threats.description: Instead of Jenkins building an image whose code has been peer reviewed, static code analysed etc, and whose build jobs are also subject to the same controls in github, a malicious insider attempts to bypass these by placing the malicious image straight into artifactory.
threats.mitigation:
Artifactory RBAC- Do not allow users to upload images directly.
In-toto (strategic)- Cryptographic traceability of supply chain materials, steps and products.

threats.title: Stored containers or user credentials accessed by artifactory employee
threats.description:
Artifactory is used as a SaaS, therefore it is managed by artifactory employees who could potentially have access to data stores

Can containers be reverse engineered to expose hardoded credentials?
threats.mitigation:
Artifactorys service management procedures are not controlled by the organisation.
This is a residual risk that requires acceptance

threats.title: Artifactory suffers an outage
threats.description:
Artifactory suffers an outage due to DDOS/ failure.

This means that application containers cannot be pulled down and deployed
threats.mitigation:
Caching of app containers on hosts.
Residual risk for business to accept.

threats.title: Artifactory user/co-tenant exploits vulnerability to gain access to an organisations repo
threats.description: A vulnerability in Artifactory SaaS results in a user/co-tenant/ internet based threat actor bypassing controls and gaining access to images/ modifying them
threats.mitigation:
Residual risk to be accepted by the business
in-toto (future)

threats.title: MIsconfigured Bot Account
threats.description:
A Bot account is misconfigured, and is exploited by a threat actor for malicious purposes.
For example a developer obtain the bot token and could replace a container built by jenkins with a malicious variant.
threats.mitigation:
Artifactory RBAC least privilege to limit Bot account scope
Jenkins RBAC to reduce bot account credential exposure
In-toto will ensure that only containers built by Jenkins can be deployed. - dependent on where the verification step happens.

threats.title: Open Source Dependency Compromised at source (TBC)
threats.description: An open source software element is compromised at source, pulled into artifactory as a container for subsequent deployment.

threats.title: Former employee retains artifactory access
threats.description: Due to a lack of offboarding a former employee retains access to Artifactory, he/she could use permissions to pull containers or even replace/tamper with them.
threats.mitigation:
Offboarding process
User Audit
Use of SSO

cells.reasonOutOfScope: Exposure of deployed app part of platform/infrastructure threat model.

threats.title: EBS data accessed by AWS administrator
threats.description: EBS is an Amazon service, it could be accessed by an AWS administrator, revealing the Jenkins config including bot credentials.
threats.mitigation:
Amazon service management processes are out of scope
Using AWS KMS for encryption increases the number of AWS personnel required to access the data in plaintext. Reducing the likelihood of a compromise in confidentiality.

cells.reasonOutOfScope: EBS as a supporting technology part of AWS management threat model?

threats.title: Committed Code is tampered with in transit
threats.description: Developer > Github interaction is subject to a MITM attack and code is tampered with in transit
threats.mitigation: Use of HTTPS. The client browser must be kept up to date to support the most up to date ciphers.

threats.title: Code confidentiality in transit is compromised due to packet sniffing
threats.description: Code confidentiality in transit is disclosed due to packet sniffing by a threat actor, compromising confidentiality of code and embedded plaintext credentials.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt in transit using HTTPS. Keep client browser up to date to support up to date ciphers

threats.title: Lack of connectivity to Github
threats.mitigation: It's reachable over the internet....

threats.title: Malicious user commands host to pull malicious image from external repo
threats.description:
A malicious user on the EC2 host want to run some malicious tooling for discovery/to undertake an attack, on the rest of the estate. e.g. Nmap, medusa.

To do this he pulls down a malicious docker image from an external repo.
threats.mitigation:
Limit Docker pull to organisations Artifactory repository
Limit Docker pull to signed containers (?) e.g those built and signed by Jenkins?
Logging/Protective Monitoring

threats.title: Docker Container run as root on host
threats.description:
Docker container running as root on the host. i.e using the --privileged flag. 

There is no isolation between the container and the host, thus allowing the docker container to exploit all capabilities provided by the host.
threats.mitigation:
Run processes as non-root within the container. Map processes to non-root users on the host.
All docker containers running build and test jobs to be built and run as non-root by jenkins ?
Is there a control within docker to prevent a container running as root? -Apparmour/Docker?
Logging and PM?

threats.title: Docker daemon socket mounted into Jenkins container
threats.description:
For Jenkins to run build and test jobs in containers on the same host, the 
socket for the hosts docker daemon is mounted into the container. 
As the docker daemon runs as root, Jenkins effectively has the ability to write root level commands to the host.
threats.mitigation: Build test and job as container- push to artifactory, deploy within Kubernetes?

threats.title: User with SSH access can view all build/test jobs
threats.description: Should the host house multiple Jenkins instances, for different projects, then a user with SSH access can view all of the ongoing jobs/tests.  By execing onto a container
threats.mitigation:
TBC
Logging and Protective Monitoring

threats.title: Internet based threat actor gains SSH access via SSH bruteforce
threats.description:
The server uses UserID/Password authentication for SSH.
This is bruteforced by a internet based threat actor
threats.mitigation:
Place EC2 instance behind VPN
Restrict access to EC2 instance to management/support locations using IP whitelisting enforced by AWS security Groups & ACLs
Use Public Key Authentication for SSH.
Logging & Protective Monitoring

threats.title: EC2 instance spoofed to obtain SSH username/password
threats.description: EC2 instance spoofed to obtain SSH username/password
threats.mitigation: Validation of Server Fingerprint by user on login

threats.title: Internet based threat actor exploits vulnerability on EC2 host to gain access
threats.mitigation:
Keep EC2 host OS patched
Port and Service hardening
Logging and Protective Monitoring
threats.description: Internet facing EC2 instance has a vulnerability which is exploited leading to elevation of privilege.

threats.title: EC2 IAM permissions exploited
threats.description:
EC2 instance have the ability to inherit IAM roles.
Privileged containers on the EC2 host, such as the Jenkins Container, can exploit these roles to perform a variety of actions, such as modify the AWS infrastructure
threats.mitigation:
Enforce least privilege on IAM roles inherited by hosts.
Do not run privileged containers.

cells.reasonOutOfScope: AWS Infrastructure management is out of scope of this threat model

text.text:
Build and Test
Jobs in Docker

cells.reasonOutOfScope: Within scope of Platform Threat Modelling
